innerTabs.name: commingle_differential_pressure
innerTabs.label: Commingle Differential Pressure
innerTabs.tooltip: Justification can also be made to BOEM to group independent sand lobes into a reservoir package when an initial field development plan is proposed (i.e. M4/M6 sands or M1/M2 sands at Mars).  This will allow for completing these sand packages without commingling approval during the production life cycle.  Also, when reservoirs are shown to be in pressure communication (i.e. upper and lower yellow sands at Mars) commingling approval will be granted beyond the 200 Δpsi limit.  Attached below are some Mars examples of these commingle completion types.  WM -50 at Perdido and Stones Wilcox  Multi-Zone Completions are also examples.

content.name: IsDifferentialPressureBetweenZoneGreaterThan200psi
content.label: Is the differential pressures between the zones greater than 200 psi?

content.name: IsDifferentialPressureGreaterThan200_result_warning
content.label: Continue

content.name: WillPressureEqualizeAllowingCommingledFlow
content.label: If one zone is produced for a brief period time (<6 months), will the pressure equalize allowing for commingled flow?
content.tooltip: NOTE: Otherwise, the regulator needs to be engaged on a variance to the 200 psi requirement; this is especially important if reserves could otherwise not be economically produced.

content.name: IsPressureEqualize_result_warning
content.label: A stacked selective multi-zone system could be installed and a S/L intervention executed several months after completion to commingle well. Note that in most (but not all) cases an intervention on a subsea well out weighs the incremental cost for a smart well.

content.name: IsPressureEqualize_result_pass
content.label: Smart Well would be required to commingle zones

innerTabs.name: regulatory_screening
innerTabs.label: Regulatory Screening Requirements for Commingling
innerTabs.tooltip: These requirements are applicable for all commingling concepts.

content.name: IsFormationFluidCompatible
content.label: Are the formation fluids compatible?
content.tooltip: NOTE: Per Shell Regulatory, BSEE requires a demonstration of fluid compatibility in order to approve a commingle permit. An approved commingle permit has been previously required prior to receive an approved completions APM. BSEE has accepted the following as proof of fluid compatibility. Compatibility of  both hydrocarbons and produced water is required. -Analog data -Geochemical finger printing demonstrating similar fluid properties i.e. similar densities and viscosities -Produced water compatibility testing (if samples exist) -Hydrocarbon compatibility testing (if samples exist) -Scale mitigations to be used if required during commingling -If chemical compatibility is an issue, provide details on compatibility control measure i.e. chemical injection through deep CIM. Evaluate if fluids are suitable for small radius/non-asphaltene scaling

content.name: IsFormationFluidCompatible_result
content.label: Stop

content.name: IsFormationFluidCompatible_result_right
content.label: 1st regulatory requirement met.

content.name: zoneSelection
content.label: Choose 1
content.tooltip: NOTE: If the total EUR of a well is increased, but the zonal EUR of the primary zone is impacted by adding an incremental zone that otherwise would not be obtained may be a justification for commingling. Further engagement with BSEE is likely to be required.

options.name: zoneSelection
options.label: EUR of each zone of a multi-zone well has equal or greater EUR of each zone of single zone single well scenarios? Utilize "base case" forecasts for modelling

options.name: zoneSelection
options.label: Is there a zone that can be obtained economically with a multi-zone well that wouldn't be obtained otherwise (uneconomical for a standalone well, no other planned penetrations)?

content.name: IsFormationFluidCompatible_result_1
content.label: 2nd regulatory requirement met.

content.name: IsFormationFluidCompatible_result_2
content.label: 2nd regulatory requirement met with caustion If the total EUR of a well is increased, but the zonal EUR of the primary zone is impacted by adding an incremental zone that otherwise would not be obtained may be a justification for commingling. Further engagement with BSEE is likely to be required.

content.name: IsFormationFluidCompatible_result_3
content.label: Stop

content.name: IsComminglingStrong
content.label: Is commingling justification "strong" or "weak"? Review "story" (proposal/justification) for commingling with Shell Regulatory
content.tooltip: NOTE:  The total EUR associated with the multi-zone well concept will be determined towards the end of the concept assessment process as more detailed modelling would be required.

content.name: TotalEurAssociatedWithStackCommingle_result2
content.label: Proceed with standard BSEE engagment timelines/strategy

content.name: TotalEurAssociatedWithStackCommingle_result
content.label: Consider early engagment with BSEE

content.name: IsOpenHoleCompletionFeasible
content.label: Is an Open Hole completion feasible? COMPLETE OH SCREENING WORKFLOW: - DIF & Breaker Screening- D&C Feasibility- Second Tier Assessment

content.name: IsOpenHoleCompletionFeasible_result
content.label: Evaluate Cased Hole option -- go to Casing Size Screening module for CH options

content.name: AreAllFHBPOrStaticBHPLessThan5000
content.label: During production phase, are all FHBPs and/or static BHPs <5,000 psi for life of completion?
content.tooltip: NOTE:  Generally OH architecture may result in lower overall total D&C well costs, with potential production benefit

content.name: AreAllFHBPOrStaticBHPLessThan5000_result
content.label: Evaluate Cased Hole option -- go to Casing Size Screening module for CH options

content.name: IsHoleSizeSmallerThan614
content.label: Screen for OH sizes. Is hole size smaller than 6-1/4"?
content.tooltip: Note:  MZ systems for hole sizes less than 6-1/4" are not currently in use in DW portfolio

content.name: IsHoleSizeSmallerThan614_result
content.label: Stop

content.name: NominalOHSize
content.label: What is nominal OH size?

content.name: NominalOHSize_result_1
content.label: Consider "big bore" OH systems --> see reference 35 Multi Zone Comparison Summary

content.name: NominalOHSize_result_2
content.label: Consider "slim" OH systems --> see reference 35 Multi Zone Comparison Summary

content.name: IsRobustZonalIsolationRequired
content.label: Is robust zonal isolation required for any reason during execution or lifecycle reservoir managment reason? i.e. - differential depletion- water breakthrough or avoidance - shale stability - etc.
content.tooltip: NOTE:  Flag "best practice" pressure limts for OH systems to remain isolated between zones Other considerations: -Solids and sand control compaction Effectiveness of OH fracturing and lack of experience in this space; see experience from Chevron re: OHF&P completions. Current data set is very limited on effeciency of OH F&P completions.

content.name: IsRobustZonalIsolationRequired_result
content.label: Cased hole systems - proceed to casing size screening

content.name: IsRobustZonalIsolationRequired_result-2
content.label: OH Completions Feasible

innerTabs.name: breaker_screeening
innerTabs.label: DIF and Breaker Screening
innerTabs.tooltip: In high temperature environments where there is a significant time delay between initial completion and well unloading/first oil, consider barite flowback for cleanup, possibly direct to rig

content.name: FluidSystemCellColor
content.label: According to the DIF systems matrix, what color cell does your fluid system fall into? (see reference 23 in REFERENCES tab)
content.tooltip: Consider shale reactivity when selecting fluids. (see reference 20 in REFERENCES tab) Consider maximum overbalance (OB) limits;  experience suggests maximum of 1,800 psi OB for water-based mud (WBM). Shell SWA -248 in Brunei  was drilled at 2000 psi overbalance with WBM. However, a properly designed WBM will need to be used in these higher overbalance conditions (2000 psi). A high solids loaded WBM system may not

content.name: FluidSystemCellColor_result1
content.label: Stop

content.name: FluidSystemCellColor_result3
content.label: DIF Feasible

content.name: IsThereSufficientTimeforDIFDevelopment
content.label: Sufficient time for DIF development?

content.name: IsThereSufficientTimeforDIFDevelopment_result1
content.label: Stop

content.name: IsThereSufficientTimeforDIFDevelopment_result2
content.label: DIF Feasible

content.name: DoesTrajectoryFallWithinLocalDrillingEnvelop
content.label: Concept Identification -- Propose sand face completion length and hole angle Does trajectory fall within local drilling envelope?

content.name: DoesTrajectoryFallWithinLocalDrillingEnvelop_result_1
content.label: Trajectory not feasible

content.name: DoesTrajectoryFallWithinLocalDrillingEnvelop_result_2
content.label: Drilling Feasibility - Further Analysis Does trajectory keep DLS below 6 degrees? Will ECD limits be honored given hole size, mud weight? Meet T&D req's for drilling and completion installation?

content.name: CanReachTDAtHoleSizeGreaterThan614
content.label: Can reach TD at hole size ≥ 6-1/4"?

content.name: DoesHorizontalTrajectoryKeepDLSBelow6_result
content.label: Stop

content.name: AreThereSelectableSystems
content.label: Evaluate individual stage spacing - see  Selection table for system size and stage size options Are there selectable systems for given hole size, trajectory, and stage spacing?

content.name: AreThereSelectableSystems_result_1
content.label: Trajectory feasible

content.name: AreThereSelectableSystems_result_2
content.label: Stop

content.name: WillThereBeFrequentPostCompletionPumpingTreatments
content.label: Will there be frequent post-completion pumping treatments?

content.name: WillThereBeFrequentPostCompletionPumpingTreatments_result_1
content.label: Continue

content.name: WillThereBeFrequentPostCompletionPumpingTreatments_result_2
content.label: Further evaluate future wellbore utility trade offs with commingled MZ well (NOT SHOWSTOPPER)

content.name: IsThereFutureUHRCTarget
content.label: Is there a future UHRC target in wellbore?

content.name: CanUHRCTargetBePenetratedAtAngleLessThan55
content.label: Can UHRC target be penetrated at angle < 55 degrees?

content.name: CanUHRCTargetBePenetratedAtAngleLessThan55_result
content.label: continue

content.name: DoesPlannedTrajectoryPutUHRCBehindCasing
content.label: Does the planned trajectory put the UHRC behind 2 strings of casing?

content.name: DoesHorizontalTrajectoryPutUHRCBehindCasing_result_1
content.label: Further evaluate future wellbore utility trade offs with commingled MZ well (NOT SHOWSTOPPER)

content.name: DoesHorizontalTrajectoryPutUHRCBehindCasing_result_2
content.label: Continue

innerTabs.name: sandControlFesibility
innerTabs.label: OH Sand Control Fesibility - SAS Screening

content.name: IsD50GreaterThan75Microns
content.label: Is UC > 5? Are fines < 45 microns present at less than 5%? Is d50 > 75 microns? Is N/G > 60%?

content.name: HaveWeInstalledSASInSimilarReservoirs
content.label: Have we (or industry)  installed SAS in similar reservoirs?

content.name: IsRetentionTestAvailable
content.label: Is there a retention test available (or analog) for SAS?

content.name: IsD10LessThan175
content.label: Is d10 < 175 microns?

content.name: IsEnoughTimeAvailableToPerformTest
content.label: Is there enough time available to perform test?
content.tooltip: Take into account unconfined compressive strength (UCS) values with regards to possible lower chances of hole collapsing around screen. Also related to drawdown.

content.name: IsD10LessThan175_result_1
content.label: SAS not feasible

content.name: IsD10LessThan175_result_2
content.label: Confirm we are willing to take that risk

content.name: IsRetentionTestAvailable_result
content.label: Pass

innerTabs.name: OHGPCarrierFluidCompatibilityScreening
innerTabs.label: OHGP/Gravel Pack Carrier Fluid Compatibility Screening

content.name: IsDrillInFluidSBMorWBM
content.label: Is drill-in fluid SBM or WBM?

options.name: IsDrillInFluidSBMorWBM
options.label: SBM - Likely not compatible with GP carrier fluid
options.value: SBM - Likely not compatible with GP carrier fluid

options.name: IsDrillInFluidSBMorWBM
options.label: WBM - Likely compatible with GP carrier fluid
options.value: WBM - Likely compatible with GP carrier fluid

content.name: CanGPPumpProcedureBeChanged
content.label: Can GP pump procedure be changed. spacer added, etc.?
content.condition: {IsDrillInFluidSBMorWBM} == 'SBM - Likely not compatible with GP carrier fluid'

content.name: CanGPPumpProcedureBeChanged_result
content.label: OHGP not feasible

content.name: AreShalesPresentThatRequireIsolation
content.label: Are shales present that require isolation with OH packers or use of Shunt Screens?
content.condition: {IsDrillInFluidSBMorWBM} == 'WBM - Likely compatible with GP carrier fluid' || {CanGPPumpProcedureBeChanged} == 'Yes'

content.name: AreShalesPresentThatRequireIsolation_result_1
content.label: OHGP Feasible

content.name: AreShalesPresentThatRequireIsolation_result_2
content.label: Investigate GP pumping with OH packers or Shunt Screens, highlight risk increases

content.name: IsOneOfOHSASOrOHGPFeasible
content.label: Is one of either OHSAS or OHGP technically feasible?

content.name: IsOneOfOHSASOrOHGPFeasible_result_1
content.label: Stop

content.name: IsOneOfOHSASOrOHGPFeasible_result_2
content.label: Continue

content.name: NominalCasingSize
content.label: What is nominal casing size?
content.tooltip: NOTE:  Applies for OH or CH system selection NOTE: 7" solutions will be limited

content.name: NominalCasingSize_result_1
content.label: See reference 35 Multi Zone Comparison Summary for available solutions

content.name: NominalCasingSize_result_2
content.label: Stop

content.name: NumberOfStagesRequiredForProposedSandFaceCompletion
content.label: How many stages are required for proposed sand face completion?
content.tooltip: NOTE:  This module applies for either OH or CH system selection, NOTE:  See Reference 8 Multi-Zone Cost Screening Tool. Typcially ≥3 zones/stages are needed for MZ systems to be attractive for TLP applications, while MZ systems are likely competitive for ≥2 stages for SS wells. NOTE:  Consider min/max separation on stages when selecting system

content.name: NumberOfStagesRequiredForProposedSandFaceCompletion_result_1
content.label: Evaluate value proposition of MZ system against conventional stacked completions

content.name: NominalCasingSize_result_2
content.label: Multi Zone Comparison Summary for available solutions

content.name: NominalCasingSize_result_3
content.label: See reference 35 Multi Zone Comparison Summary  for available solutions; >6 stages will eliminate numerous options

innerTabs.name: lower_completion_screening
innerTabs.label: Cased Hole Lower Completion Installation Screening

content.name: IsThereAtleastOneCommerciallyAvailableSystem
content.label: Evaluate selectable systems for given hole size, trajectory, and stage spacing - see reference 35 Multi Zone Comparison Summary for system size and stage size options. Is there at least one commercially available system given requirements above?

content.name: DoesWellDesignAllowForSufficientSumpLength
content.label: Does well design allow for sufficient sump length for MZ system selection?

content.name: DoesWellDesignAllowForSufficientSumpLength_result
content.label: Pass - continue technical screening

content.name: IsThereAtleastOneCommerciallyAvailableSystem_result_1
content.label: Re-evaluate well architecture

content.name: IsProposedTotalCompletionLengthLessThanSystemLimitations
content.label: Is proposed total completion length less than system limitations (T&D, friction, rates & volumes, etc.)?
content.tooltip: NOTE:  Can you perforate in 1 trip - Y/N? If NO, may not be a show-stopper If completion length > LC system limitations (Friction, rates/volumens, etc.), consider stacking LC systems May not ultimately affect system selection BUT may impact COST or RISK PROFILE reference min sump length (reference 35 Multi Zone Comparison Summary)

content.name: IsProposedTotalCompletionLengthLessThanSystemLimitations_result
content.label: Pass - continue technical screening

content.name: IsProposedTotalCompletionLengthLessThanSystemLimitations_result_1
content.label: Evaluate opportunity to stack systems

content.name: IsMultiZoneCommingledWellTechnicallyFeasible
content.label: See "Single Cased Hole Gravel Pack" workflow for determination on need for stimulation (e.g. hydraulic fracturing) and sand control solutions (HRWP vs. F&P) Is a Multi-Zone commingled well technically feasible?
content.tooltip: NOTE:  Consider: Perm & reservoir properties -- see Stones, Whale Sand control -- see GMUB (Greater Mars Ursa Basin) Outflow limits -- see Appo Fluid loss pill clean-up -- see Appo Compaction -- see GMUB Water contacts Stage separation Can apply to both OH or CH, but not necessarily to a specific solution. GENERALLY, base case assumption for OH completions likely to be stimulated (fracture treated or F&P)

content.name: IsMultiZoneCommingledWellTechnicallyFeasible_result_1
content.label: Continue

content.name: IsMultiZoneCommingledWellTechnicallyFeasible_result_2
content.label: Stop

content.name: CanMultiZoneCompletionSystemReduceWellCount
content.label: Can a multi-zone completion system reduce well count?

content.name: CanMultiZoneCompletionSystemReduceWellCount_result_1
content.label: Include Savings in NPV Calcs $75 mln SS $50 mln TLP

content.name: CanMultiZoneCompletionSystemReduceWellCount_result_2
content.label: No additional cost savings to capture in NPV calcs

innerTabs.name: Differential_Depletion_Screening
innerTabs.label: Differential Depletion Screening
innerTabs.tooltip: These questions should be answered based on notional understanding of the wellbore, reservoir, and FDP. Answering yes to these questions would kickoff more detailed CGM and Prosper modelling

content.name: WillSignificantDepletionOccur
content.label: Will significant differential depletion occur ( >1,000 psi) during the well life?
content.tooltip: NOTE:  In the detailed design phase: -Verify timing of differential depletion. If significant differential depletion doesn't occur until 5+ yrs. from initial production, the value associated with later life production may not justify the additional cost for a smart well. Additionally, the reliability of the ICV's decreases overtime and therefore the late life recovered volumes should be risked accordingly in the value analysis. -Add survivability data of ICVs -Flag different PIs between zones and optimize production from each zone accordingly

content.name: WillSignificantDepletionOccur_result_1
content.label: Pass - continue to screen for additional applicable smart well benefits Quantify differential depletion SW benefits via production & reservoir modelling

content.name: WillSignificantDepletionOccur_result_2
content.label: Assumption is that once significant differential depletion occurs, the zones should be operated with zonal control to optimize production, reduce crossflow, etc.. If no differential depletion is expected and initial pressures are within commingle limits, a conventional commingle well could be installed. Continue value/economic screening for applicable smart well benefits.

content.name: IsEUREachZoneSignificantlyDifferent
content.label: Are the EUR's of each  zone significantly different
content.tooltip: This can be screened at or near the Early Assist phase of the WDP

content.name: IsEURZoneSignificantlyDifferent_result_pass
content.label: Pass - continue value/economic screening

content.name: WhichZoneHasHigherEUR
content.label: Which zone has significantly higher EUR?

content.name: HigherEURZone_result_warning
content.label: A plug could be installed to isolate the lower zone (or group of zones) Note that in most cases an intervention on a subsea well out weighs the incremental cost for a smart well. Continue value/economic screening for applicable smart well benefits.

content.name: HigherEURZone_result_pass
content.label: A selective well could be installed and a S/L intervention executed to close the SSD. However, the ability to successfully close the SSD will be less likely than opening an SSD for the first time. Note that in most cases an intervention on a subsea well out weighs the incremental cost for a smart well. Continue value/economic screening for applicable smart well benefits.

content.name: IsThereProductionAccelerationBenefit
content.label: Is there a production acceleration benefit or end of field life benefit of installing a second zone (or 3+ zones)?
content.tooltip: NOTE:  As an example: -Accelerating production from an uphole zone may increase EUR from the zone if current FDP production forecasts exceed EOFL estimates.

content.name: IsProductionAccelerationBenefit_result_pass
content.label: Pass - Continue to screen for additional applicable MZ  Well benefits

content.name: IsProductionAccelerationBenefit_result_warning
content.label: Continue value/economic screening for applicable MZ well benefits.

content.name: IsOneOfTheZoneWaterFlooded
content.label: Is one of the zones water flooded or is one zone expected to have significant water production before the other?
content.tooltip: H2S/metallurgy evaluation should be done if water production is expected in any zone. Consider impacts to complex metallurgy combinations in SMART kit during acid (pH 1-2) or caustic (pH 11-13) stimulations.

content.name: IsZoneFlodded_result_pass
content.label: Pass - Continue to screen for additional applicable MZ  Well benefits

content.name: IsZoneFlodded_result_warning
content.label: Continue value/economic screening for applicable MZ well benefits.

content.name: IsThereEURBenefitToZonalControl
content.label: Is there an EUR benefit to zonal control for: -GOR Optimization -PLT Elimination -Individual PTAs (i.e. Mars A-5 benefits)

content.name: IsThereEURBenefitToZonalControl_result_pass
content.label: Capture incremental NPV in value assessment

content.name: IsThereSignificantBenefitToSelectiveProductionSimulation
content.label: Is there a significant benefit to selective production stimulation or remediation?
content.tooltip: Consider all of the following: - Differences in operating procedures (different testing requirements, etc.) - Limitation of post-production logging (unable to acquire a production profile across the upper zone by means of conventional logging), stimulations (less effective), or other interventions - Value of information of shut-in zones in a smart well (pressure) - End of field life impacts - Deferment associated with SMART (ICV) regulatory integrity testing - Uncertainty in results of PTA and pressures due to design and as-installed conditions

content.name: IsSignificantBenefit_result_pass
content.label: Capture incremental NPV in value assessment

content.name: IsSignificantBenefit_result_warning
content.label: Is at least 1 of the zones large with a significant number of future development wells, where additional downhole monitoring could lead to field development optimization benefits? Capture incremental VOI value assessment

content.name: determineCostOfPotentialConcepts
content.label: Determine costs of potential, applicable MZ concepts (conventional commingle, stacked selective, commingled MZ sytem, smart MZ system)

content.name: generateValueComparison
content.label: If applicable: Conduct evaluation of high angle/slanted completions - Generate value comparison of OH vs CH concepts

content.name: generateProductionForcasts
content.label: Generate production forecasts of single zone,  conventional stacked commingle, and MZ wells

content.name: constructDecisionTreeOfConcept
content.label: Construct decision tree of concept options with risked execution, VOI events, etc...

content.name: generateFinalVirNpv
content.label: Generate final VIR, NPV, etc. of conceptual scenarios

content.name: IsThereSignificantBenefitOfCommingledMultiZoneCompletion
content.label: Is there a significant cost, rate, volume, or risk mitigation benefit of a commingled MZ completion?

content.name: IsThereSignificantBenefitOfCommingleWell_result_left
content.label: Proceed forward with Multi-zone Well Concept Selection recommendation.

content.name: IsThereSignificantBenefitOfCommingleWell_result_right
content.label: Stop
